data.title: naming the packages
data.body:
All the downloadable packages are named   "atom.x86_64.rpm" , could you please specify the  version in the package names , it will be so helpful

Thank you

data.title: New line Added upon Save File
data.body:
Hello guys,

First I need to thank you for the great Editor.

It seems like the App it's adding a new line in the bottom of the file each time I save the document.
 I use it for PHP/WEB applications and it is annoying, mostly when you need to call variables/values from file_content, when during the fact that Atom adds new lines in the bottom, the PHP interprets it as space behind the value and throws Fatal Errors. 
If I edit the file outside the Atom and remove that spare line, everything goes well.

I tried looking for an option in this matter in the Settings of Atom and couldn't find any concludent, so if you thing this report comes in an error manner (mine especially), please feel free to announce me in any way.

Thank you guys.

data.title: Add activationHooks + Trigger `{grammar-package-name}:grammar-used` Hook When A text-editor-element's Grammar Is Set
data.body:
This PR:
- Adds `activationHooks` to package.json
- Triggers the `{grammar-package-name}:grammar-used` hook when a text-editor-element's grammar is set

This allows package authors to defer package activation for language-specific packages until the first use of the grammar(s) their package serves. It also leaves open the possibility to trigger other activation hooks in the future with minimal code.
- Fixes #6629

/cc @kevinsawicki

data.title: Invalid packages settings because of config.cson
data.body:
For example,
I install the package `xpto` and this package has two settings declared on init.coffee `foo` and `bar`. And then I decide to change the value of `foo`. So my preference will be stored on config.cson. But after a while the package developer decides to deprecate the setting `foo` and removes the setting `foo` from package settings. Now when I go to the settings page of `xpto` package I will still see the `foo` setting because it is still stored on config.cson. 

Shouldn't Atom at boot check if there is any dead/invalid settings from packages?

data.title: [Windows] Install to Program Files rather then the user profile
data.body: It appears the Windows Installer will install Atom to the user profile rather then to the machine program directory - normally c:\program files. This makes things messy in a enterprise environment. Perhaps create a MSI installer that creates a machine based install using WiX. Any machine based config should be stored in c:\programdata and only user defined settings should live in the user profile - c:\users\%username%\

data.title: Sign Linux releases
data.body: Could you please provide a signed checksums file or sign the files themselves for releases so we can cryptographically verify them.  Thanks

data.title: Opening big file like jquery-UI.min.js freeze editor
data.body:
Hi Guys,
Not sure if anyone having this issue. I tried to open a jquery-ui.min.js file in the editor. It loaded and hang for like 30++ seconds before i can start editing the file.

data.title: Throw an exception when adding a non-object pane item
data.body:
Closes #5978

We end up attempting to retrieve a view for pane items from a WeakMap, which can only use objects as keys. Throwing an exception earlier helps to clarify to package authors that this won't work.

data.title: Not displaying hidden character: 200b (ZERO WIDTH SPACE)
data.body:
Not sure how the character got into my code but it does not show up in Atom even with Show Invisibles set to true.

Info on the character can be found here http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/200b/index.htm

My specific issue: If this character comes after a CSS closing curly bracket, all following styles are inaccessible and do not parse. 

Example: https://jsfiddle.net/9tuy9w8o/2/
Setting the image class to cat works but setting it to dog causes it to break.

data.title: Add project folders starting with dot
data.body:
Atom 1.0.0, running on Yosemite.

Tree View will not allow you to add a project folder if the folder name begins with a dot.

Core package Tree-view's "Hide Ignored Names" is NOT checked.

OS is set to show hidden folders in Finder, and will show those starting with a dot.

Treeview will show dot folders under the root of a project folder, but they don't get displayed in the "Add Project Folder" dialog, so there's no way to select them.

Example:  "/Users/myUser/mySubFolder1/.myDotFolder" does not get displayed in the "Add Project Folder" dialog.

However, if "/Users/myUser/mySubFolder1" is selected as a project folder, then ".myDotFolder" will show up under it in the tree view.

data.title: Diff inline highlighting selects too much text; highlights incorrectly
data.body:
Here is an example where you can see the error occuring:
![example](http://i.imgur.com/kst1f3Q.png)

I assume that the opening `[-` starts matching until the last `-]` found, when it should be searching for the first `-]` found.

As a result, `{+embargo_efficiency+}` is incorrectly coloured red and `=` is also incorrectly highlighted, even though it shouldn't be coloured at all.

data.title: Folder won't reopen folder after close on windows
data.body:
```
version: [6712:0701/134739:INFO:CONSOLE(0)] 1.0.0
devtool errors: none
os: windows 8
```

I am having a problem on windows with reopening folders. Here's usually what happens.
1. Get an issue with Atom locking files from git via cmd (usually permission error due to atom or file is locked for some reason)
2. Close Atom
3. Perform git actions
4. Open atom
   - have tried via cmd and via icon
5. If not tried from cmd, "open folder" and select folder that was previously opened before close

**Expected** atom to open folder selected from dialog or folder 'atom' was run from in cmd
**Actual** folder is never opened. It seems to unfocus on atom completely. It won't even load files from that folder when selected from "open file" or dragged into atom.

_Workaround_ is to restart your PC. 

Not sure what is going on here, and it's not the easiest to reproduce. I've tired safe mode and looked everywhere for possible errors. Would love not to restart my computer every time this happens, which is often. 

Not sure when this was last working, as it was still and issue for me prior to v1.0.0, but didn't happen as often.

Please let me know if there's any other information I can provide.

data.title: :apple: Menus: replace three period with ellipsis
data.body:
From:
[OS X Human Interface Guidelines -Terminology and Wording](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/UserExperience/Conceptual/OSXHIGuidelines/TerminologyWording.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/20000957-CH15-SW3)

> IMPORTANT
> 
> Be sure to create the ellipsis character using the key combination Option-; (Option-semicolon). This ensures that an assistive app can provide the correct interpretation of the character to a disabled user. If you use three period characters to simulate an ellipsis, many assistive apps will be unable to make sense of them. Also, three period characters and an ellipsis don't look the same because the periods are spaced differently than the points of an ellipsis.

data.title: Cannot find certain text
data.body:
To reproduce:
1. Open a new file
2. Paste the following:
`ho+8qEwxQSKZk2/h/ZS5/A==`
3.  CMD+F on MAC to open the find text panel
4. Paste the same
5. Try to find it
6. Cry

data.title: Reflow selection breaks indentation
data.body:
If I have a block of text indented and I use the "reflow selection" command (cmd+alt+q on Mac) the resulting text block will only keep the intended indentation in the first line but lose it in the following lines. While for some file types this might be the correct behaviour, IMO for many others it's not. Therefore "reflow selection" is unusable for my source code.

![screen shot 2015-07-01 at 11 57 20](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/300638/8452143/ced99d34-1fe8-11e5-910e-b9e79629aa2a.png)

If the current behaviour is still to be supported I suggest to make this a customizable behaviour, e.g., depending on file type.

data.title: Dead Keys stop working when Atom looses focus (OS X)
data.body:
When atom looses the focus (e.g. switching to another application), the dead keys (e.g. <kbd>~</kbd>, <kbd>´</kbd>, <kbd>`</kbd>) stop working in the active editor, so there is no (preliminary) input when pressing the key. It does not affect the other editors of the window.

If you activate another editor and then switch back to the previous one, the dead keys are working again...

data.title: Keyboard layout: open bracket is not displayed
data.body:
I'm using Win 7, 64bit.
Atom version: 1.0.0

I'm using a Hungarian keyboard layout and I have trouble entering the open bracket [ symbol.

Pressing AltGr F produces this:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/342688/8451032/3e1608f8-1fe0-11e5-82e0-ba3b639c066f.png)

This is how special characters are laid out for us:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/342688/8451064/76d7ff5c-1fe0-11e5-94ba-99ff95cebf06.png)

I'd expect this to be handled by default, without any extra configuration.

data.title: Atom modify a lot of lines when I make some changes in my files
data.body:
When I do a "git diff" I can see these modified lines, the final result is that the file keeps just the changes I did, but it is very awful when you want to see what changes you did, and especially when you working with a team and others want to see what you have changed in the file. As an example, this is the output of "git diff" when I do a simple change. NOTE: I only changed the last line, however all of that "-+" couples appears. Not sure what's happening... :confused: ``` diff .fc-day, - .fc-widget-content + .fc-widget-content { background : #FFF !important; } - + .fc-day-header{ background-color: #e86484 !important; } @@ -72,7 +72,7 @@
-
